summary_reasoning: The report contains primarily generic restatements and copied content with minimal original synthesis. While it provides extensive company detail, most insights are standard banking analysis points that could apply broadly across the sector. The stress test analysis offers some synthesis by connecting lower capital requirements to potential shareholder returns, but this remains relatively generic. The moat analysis extensively rehashes standard banking competitive factors without novel company-specific angles. The valuation section lacks innovative drivers, relying on standard DCF methodology with conventional assumptions. The report demonstrates thorough research but fails to provide the distinctive, decision-relevant insights needed for a higher grade.

insights_classified.text: Lower capital requirements correspond with higher leverage and higher returns
Banks will see stress capital buffers decline by about 40 basis points on average
Citi is in the midst of a major turnaround and remains a complex story
The bank's commercial operations have large trading, investment banking, international corporate banking
We project the bank will struggle to meet our assigned cost of equity of 10%
Citi's cost of interest-bearing deposits has been consistently higher than industry average

red_flags: Standard stress test recap without unique angle
